events.text: Alora, I'm beginning to grow tiresome of this squabaling. It's not very devine-like.
You can be tired of it all you wish, it does not change the fact his soul remains here till we agree, Pickett.

(verbal grunt of frustration)
Must you always do this at the worst occastions? I told you. I collect the souls, you greet them.
They have been our roles since the dawn of human existance. 
Literally.
We act as a balanced force.

We do, until we disagree. It's not often so don't complain. 
Do you not recall your reluctance to let some of my souls pass through?

(He pauses, sarcastically)
Ah yes. But they DID get through didn't they? 
You got to introduce them to their cycle on Earth and I met them at the end of it. 
So why is this one so difficult for you?

...
Because. It doesn't feel right. I don't think his time should be cut so short.
He can live again! Let him come with me!

Short?! Alora look at this man. He is elderly, his child soul vanished long ago, his adult soul is lost and here he is.
A leftover.
He is an elder  soul, ready to be collected. That's all. Let him go to the Afterlife with me.

Don't talk about him like that!
Nobody is beyond help Pickett. Did you not notice how he is here alone?

Something tells me that was his own doing. 
Grave Mortal mistake I suppose. Won't matter once he's passed on.

(A more enthusiastic grunt of frustration)
Why are you always so stubborn?!
Look at the weather! This is why sun-showers happen!
I can't continue to keep your dreary away from my radiance!

(he scoffs)
Oh, my sincerest apologies Alora, I forgot YOU were the sole deity reponsible for the human cycle of exhistance.
How do you possibly manage it all?

So what does that make you since you love to go where I go? A..
Follower perhaps?
Charmed.

Pickett... I just believe there is more to this humans story than we think.
I think he should come with me and start over in a different human cycle!
There must be a reason he's ended like this. All of our humans' cycles have made sense besides his. Can't you at least agree on that?
I suppose his does have missing pieces for some reason.
Exactly! Listen, we are equals. We created the humans, together.
I do not need a history lesson. I was there.

-All I'm requesting is we take a second look at his life.
Something happened that made his soul untraceable to either of us.
He never tilted the forces towards you or I.

Hmm... that is odd, I'll admit.
Crafty- for an old man.

(excitable)
Perfect! Then it's settled! I will search for information.

Oh no Alora, you will not. In fact, if you are going to interfere with my work... we will use something of an equal nature between us both.
ALORA and PICKETT turn to OWLNU who has been watching their discussion.
Owlnu. Why don't you consider this your first task to the start of your eternity.

Owlnu! My apologies, I forgot you were there.
I don't mean to discuss deity roles with Pickett in front of you.

Oh don't try to play innocent now Alora, you awknowledge everyone.
It's kind of a nuissance. You knew Owlnu was there.
Go around this man's home now Owlnu, see if you can find anything that will shed some... light on the problem at hand.
-Hey!
(chuckles)

Don't allow him to boss you around like that Owlnu, though you're a younger deity, you still are one!
And we ALL deserve respect for our roles.
Yes well, We wouldn't have needed Owlnu if you had just stuck to yours.

(ignoring Him)
So would you please, if it's no bother of course, go around this gentlemans home and see what you can find that may help us understand his story?
Owlnu can walk around using Up, Down, Left, Right buttons

That feather duster on your back should be able to help! 
Very intuitive of you! 
This place is old, much like him, and has gotten quite dusty, so it may help you uncover some things!
Oh goodie. What a fun way to tell them they'll be cleaning a dying man's home for free.

(another grunt)
Would you stop! 
Currency doesn't mean anything to us anyway!
Well... That wasn't a no.
